name: Mild Mexican-Style Turkey & Rice Stuffed Peppers
description: Bell peppers filled with a mild turkey, tomato, and cumin-oregano rice mix, then oven-baked until tender. Family-friendly flavors with optional fresh coriander and avocado to finish.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 cup brown rice in a sieve.
Halve 4 large bell peppers lengthwise; remove seeds and membranes. Rub cut sides with a little olive oil.
Finely chop 1 medium onion and 3 cloves garlic.
Pick and chop a small handful of coriander (optional). Slice 1 avocado and cut 1 lime into wedges (optional).
cook_steps: Cook rice: In a pot, combine rinsed brown rice with 2 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until tender, 30–35 minutes. Fluff and set aside.
While rice cooks, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook until translucent, 4–5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add 500 g turkey and cook, breaking it up, until no longer pink, 5–7 minutes.
Stir in 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 teaspoon oregano, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, and 1 teaspoon salt. Cook 1 minute.
Add diced tomatoes and 1 tablespoon tomato paste. Simmer 5 minutes to thicken.
Stir cooked rice into the turkey mixture and adjust seasoning to taste (salt and pepper).
Arrange pepper halves cut-side up in a baking dish. Spoon filling evenly into each half and cover dish loosely with foil.
Bake covered for 20 minutes, then uncover and bake 10–15 minutes more until peppers are tender.
Rest 5 minutes. Top with chopped coriander and sliced avocado if using, and serve with lime wedges.

ingredients.quantity: 2 tablespoons, plus a little for peppers

final_ingredients.quantity: 2 tablespoons, plus a little for peppers
